name: chlorohydroquinone

The hydrogen chloride can also participate in hydrogen bonding, which might raise the melting point by approximately +10 degrees Celsius. The ketone group introduces polar carbonyl interactions, contributing approximately +40 degrees Celsius. The hydroxyl group introduces additional rigid structures that can participate in dipole interactions and potentially hydrogen bonding, raising the melting point by about +20 degrees Celsius.
